title: cDNA Display Mediated Immuno-PCR (cD-IPCR): A Novel PCR-based Antigen Detection Method
procedures:
Synthesis of cnvK-rG puromycin-linker (Figure 2)Please refer (Nemoto et al., 2018 or Terai et al., 2019) for the detailed protocol of formation of the cnvK-rG puromycin-linker.imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/20191218/20191218012312_6313.jpgFigure 2. Schematic diagram of puromycin-linker DNA. The puromycin-linker DNA comprises four parts: a photo cross-linking site for mRNA (cnvK), a primer region for reverse transcription, a biotin moiety for immobilization onto SA beads for purification, and a restriction site for release from SA beads. In addition, the linker has puromycin moiety and FITC moiety for detection.Construction anti-GFP VHH DNA templates and their PCR amplificationPrepare the Anti-GFP VHH coding DNA construct as follows. If you want to use other VHHs, please change “Anti-GFP VHH” part. The DNA construct can be chemically synthesized as an artificial gene on a plasmid or overlap extension PCR from several fragments. Please ensure that there is no stop codon before cnvK NewYtag region.table:

 PCR amplification to generate appropriate DNA concentrations as follows: Mix 2 µl of DNA sample (~50 ng), 1 µl of 10 µM Forward primer, 1 µl of 10 µM Reverse primer, 4 µl of 2.5 mM dNTP Mix, 10 µl of 5x PrimeSTAR buffer (Mg2+), 0.5 µl of PrimeSTAR HS DNA polymerase (2.5 U/µl), and UPDW up to 50 µl in PCR tube.The PCR program is as follows: 98 °C for 1 min, 98 °C for 10 s, 64 °C for 5 s, 72 °C for 37 s (extension time is dependent on the DNA length), repeat 25 cycles of these three steps, followed by 72 °C for 2 min. Forward primer: 5′-GATCCCGCGAAATTAATACGACTCACTATAGGG-3’ and Reverse primer: 5′-TTTCCACGCCGCCCCCCGTCCT-3′.Analyze the amplification of DNA on 4% denaturing urea polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (PAGE) using a gel imager as follows.Note: Ensure there are no sub bands during amplification and if so, adjust the PCR cycles or cut the correct gel band and purify the DNA. Mix 0.5 µl of DNA sample, 1.5 µl of UPDW and 2 µl of 2x loading buffer. Use 100 bp DNA Ladder as the marker (Recipe 1).Denature the DNA by heating at 85 °C for 5 min before loading.Perform PAGE analyses for 20 min at 60 °C, 200 V using gels (1 mm thickness) containing 8 M urea (Recipe 2), with 0.5x TBE as a running buffer (Recipe 3). Purify the DNA using FavorPrep DNA purification kit. Use UPDW as eluent. Measure the DNA concentration using NanoDrop.

Synthesis of cDNA display moleculesIn vitro transcriptionPrepare the transcription reaction solution as follows: mix 4 µl of 5x T7 transcription buffer, 6 µl of 25 mM each rNTP mix [mix equal volumes of four individual 100 mM rNTPs (rATP, rCTP, rGTP, and rUTP)], 200 ng of the template DNA, 2 µl of T7 Enzyme Mix, and add nuclease-free water up to 20 µl.ncubate at 37 °C for 2-4 h on a heat block.Note: The amount of mRNA will depend on the incubation time.Add 2 µl of RQ-1 RNase-free DNase and incubate at 37 °C for 15 min on a heat block.Purify the transcript (mRNA) with RNA Clean-Up kit.Determine its concentration by absorbance at 260 nm using NanoDrop.Note: The concentration of mRNA should be over 2 pmol/µl and the ratio of 260/280 nm should be over 1.8.Store the mRNA at -80 °C until use.Photo-crosslinking between mRNA and cnvK-rG puromycin-linkerPrepare the photo-crosslinking reaction solution as follows: mix 4 µl of 1 M NaCl, 4 µl of 0.25 M Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 20 pmol of cnvK-rG puromycin-linker, 20 pmol of mRNA, and nuclease-free water up to 20 µl.Note: It is convenient to prepare working solution of the ligation product (mRNA-puromycin-linker) as 1 pmol/µl.Incubate at 90 °C for 1 min followed by lowering the temperature to 70 °C at a rate of 0.4 °C/s and incubate for 1 min and then cool down to 25 °C at a rate of 0.08 °C/s using a thermocycler.Irradiate (in the same tube) with UV light at 365 nm for about 30 s using a UV cross linker.Prepare the samples for gel electrophoresis the same as described above in Procedure B.

Analyze the photo-crosslinked product on a 4% denaturing PAGE containing 8 M urea and visualize the FITC motif in Puromycin-linker using a fluorescence gel imager (Data analysis A).Note: Binding efficiency can be estimated by analyzing the FITC band intensity ratios of bound and unbound puromycin-linker.After that, stain the same gel with SYBR Gold (Recipe 9) for ~1 min, wash with water, and take an image.Store the ligated sample at -80 °C until use. Keep 0.5 µl of the sample separately for subsequent SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).In vitro translation (synthesis of mRNA-VHH fusion molecule)Prepare the translation mixture as follows: mix 6 pmol/6 µl of photo-crosslinked product, 35 µl of Rabbit Reticulocyte Lysate, 1 µl of Amino Acid Translation Mixture, 1 µl of RNasin® Ribonuclease Inhibitor, and nuclease-free water up to 50 µl.Note: As the working solution of the mRNA-Puromycin-linker is 1 pmol/µl, 6 µl equals to 6 pmol. The reaction volume should be less than 50 µl, because of higher translation efficiency. If the reaction needs to be scaled up, prepare 50 µl of the reaction solution in several test tubes.Incubate the mixture at 30 °C for 20 min on a heat block.Add 24 µl of 3 M KCl and 6 µl of 1 M MgCl2 to each tube. Incubate at 37 °C for 60 min.Add 18 µl of 0.5 M EDTA and 98 µl (same volume to the mixture) of 2x binding buffer (Recipe 4). Incubate at 37 °C for 5 min.Collect 16.3 µl of translation reaction sample into a separate tube for subsequent SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).Immobilization of mRNA-VHH fusion molecule on streptavidin magnetic beadsTake 10 µl suspension of streptavidin (SA) magnetic beads for 1 pmol of the photo-crosslinked product (i.e., 60 µl for 6 pmol) and wash the beads twice with 200 µl of 1x binding buffer.

Note: All washing steps should be performed at room temperature.Resuspend the beads with rest of the translation reaction sample.Note: If the reaction volume is too large for one tube, use several tubes with beads. It is not necessary to cut tips during pipetting beads.Incubate the mixture in a thermo block rotator at 25 °C for 30 min.Note: Keep the beads in suspension during the incubation to avoid the aggregation of beads.Place the tube on a magnetic separator for 1 min and collect 16.3 µl of supernatant into a separate tube for subsequent SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).Discard the rest of the supernatant and wash the beads with 200 µl of 1x binding buffer for three times.Reverse transcription to form cDNA display molecules.Wash the mRNA-VHH fusion molecules immobilized on SA beads (from above procedures) with 100 µl of 1x RT Buffer.Prepare the reverse transcription (RT) reaction solution for 60 µl of SA beads as follows: mix 10 µl of 5x RT Buffer, 25 µl of 2 mM dNTP mix, 14 µl of nuclease-free water, and 1 µl of ReverTra Ace® (100 U/µl).Resuspend the SA beads in RT reaction solution and incubate at 42 °C for 30 min using a thermo block rotator.Note: Keep the beads in suspension during the incubation to avoid the aggregation of beads. Place the tube on a magnetic separator for 1 min and discard the supernatant, wash the beads twice with 200 µl of 1x binding buffer and once with 100 µl of 1x Ni-NTA binding/wash buffer (Recipe 5).Resuspend the above beads with 29.8 µl of 1x Ni-NTA binding/wash buffer and add 0.2 µl of RNase T1 (1,000 U/µl). Incubate using the rotator at 37 °C for 15 min.Note: Keep the beads in suspension during the incubation to avoid the aggregation of beads.

Place the tube on a magnetic separator for 1 min and collect the supernatant containing cDNA display molecules.Save 2.7 µl of the aliquots for SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).His-tag affinity purification of cDNA displayTake 20 µl of His Mag Sepharose Ni beads into a tube and wash twice with 100 µl of the 1× Ni-NTA binding/wash buffer.Resuspend the beads in mRNA/cDNA-VHH fusion molecule solution (supernatant of RNase T1 cleavage) and incubate at 25 °C for 120 min using the rotator.Note: Adjust the incubation temperature accordingly with incubation time to prevent DNA degradation.Place the tube on a magnetic separator for 1 min and collect 2.7 µl of supernatant into a separate tube for subsequent SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).Discard the rest of the supernatant and wash the beads twice with 100 µl of 1x Ni-NTA binding/wash buffer.Resuspend the beads in 25 µl Ni-NTA elution buffer (Recipe 6) and incubate using the rotator at 25 °C for 20 min.Note: Elution volume can be adjusted as needed and can be used for immunoassay after appropriate dilutions.Place the tube on a magnetic separator for 1 min and collect the supernatant containing purified cDNA display molecules.Save 2.5 µl of the aliquots for SDS-PAGE analysis (Procedure D).Confirmation of cDNA display formation by SDS-PAGEAliquots collected during the above process (Procedure C) correspond to 0.5 pmol of molecules each.table:

Incubate sample (4), (5) and (6) with 0.2 µl RNase H, 1 µl 10x NE buffer 2 and nuclease-free water (adjust the final volume up to 10 µl) at 37 °C for 30 min to digest the RNA/cDNA duplex.For sample (1), add 1.5 µl of UPDW and 2 µl of 2x SDS sample bufferFor samples (4), (5) and (6) after RNase H incubation, add 10 µl of 2x SDS sample buffer.For samples (2) and (3), add 16.3 µl of 2x SDS sample buffer.Incubate all samples for 5 min at 95 °C in a thermoblock before loading on a gel.Analyze the samples in SDS-PAGE containing 8 M urea (4% stacking-6% separating gel, 0.02 A, 2 h) and visualize the FITC motif in puromycin-linker using a fluorescence scanner (Recipe 7).Calculate the band intensity ratio of (1) and (6) to estimate the cDNA display formation efficiency (Data analysis B).Sandwich cD-IPCR for target protein (sfGFP) detectionCoat a polystyrene microtiter plate with 100 µl of anti-GFP pAb [anti-GFP pAb in PBS (dilution = 1:450)] and keep at 4 °C overnight.Wash the plates 3 times with 200 µl of PBS each.Add 200 µl of 1% skim milk in PBS (w/v) and incubate for 2 h at 25 °C to block the wells.Washed out the plates with 200 µl of PBS.Prepare 10-fold serial dilutions of GFP protein in PBS from 100 µg/ml to 1 ng/ml as well as the negative control (no GFP). It is recommended that all the samples should be prepared in triplicate or more.Note: In this study, we used superfolder GFP (sfGFP) as the target protein. The amino acid sequence and the methods of expression and purification of the protein is described in the original paper (Pédelacq et al., 2006).

Add 100 µl of each dilution of GFP protein to the wells and incubate at 25 °C for 2 h.Wash with 200 µl of PBS, 8 times.Dilute the cDNA display coding anti-GFP VHH (prepared as described in Procedure C) up to 65-fold with PBS-T buffer.Note: The dilution value should be changed and decided empirically depending on the target. Add 100 µl of cDNA display (corresponded to ~1.3 fmol/sample) to wells and incubate at 25 °C for 2 h.Note: It is not necessary to shake the plates during incubation. Wash with 200 µl of PBS-T, 8 times. (0.05% Tween 20 in PBS)Elute the bound cDNA display with 100 µl of 0.2 M glycine/HCl buffer (pH 2.2) for 15 min at 25 °C (Recipe 8).Neutralize the elute DNA with 20 µl of 1 M Tris-base solution and purify the cDNA display using a Favorprep kit.Use 2-8 µl of the purified cDNA display as template for the following qPCR.Perform the qPCR. The step program for PCR was as follows: 95 °C for 1 min, followed by 40 cycles of 95 °C for 15 s and 66 °C for 30 s. Forward primer: AACACCATCCTGGGCGATAG, Reverse primer: GTGTTTTTGGCGCGATCAC. The PCR mixture was prepared as follows: 10 µl of 2x reaction buffer (including enzyme and dNTP), 0.6 µl of each primer (10 µM), 2 µl of template, 0.4 µl of reference dye (ROX) and 6.4 µl of water.Note: These primers are specific to anti-GFP VHH. So, if another VHH or peptide aptamer is used, design an appropriate primer set using software such as Primer Express 3.01. When performing qPCR, use anti-GFP VHH DNA to prepare the standard curve (100 pM, 1 pM, 10 fM,100 aM), and include a primer only control to verify the quality of amplification.
Calculate the difference of Ct values between the samples and the negative control containing no GFP (Data analysis C).
